column4: if you are on live CD now then your HD might not be mounted at all - so it wont show up in baoab or with du
then please type df -h in the console to see how full the partitions are
/dev/sda5 is full
I was speaking two thwo or three people helping me. I can single them out again, I suppose
problem is: when you don't use your partner's  nick  he may not see your answer (we are reading sevearl channels usually)
but if several people were helping me, its not efficient to single out one person, is it?
you can use several nicks too - but thats not your problem  I guess
I didn't understand from that ubot output, how you do several nicks
jonzbcc: jonzbcc: just like this
OH, I thought irssi only highlights messsages where your name is first.
you type the first characters of a nick, press <tab>, then the next....
back to your problem: as I said your /dev/sda5 (/) is full - next step du -s /media/8e.../* to find the biggest directory there
I just wrote to Nitsuga before he said "continue with " me (see it?)
yes I saw it - your home partition is not relevant - please type  du -s /media/8e.../* | sort -n to find the biggest directory there
or are you within the real system now?
heres `du -s /media/8.../* | sort -n ` : http://paste.ubuntu.com/381845/
no, I'm doing these things via live cd
now you see the biggest directory is var, next step du -s /media/8e.../var/* | sort -n to find the biggest one there
is there a way to hide all the traffic in irssi (its not even content, its just "quit" "join" etc)? -- and okay, I'll dig down into var and see if I find anything
I'm sure there is but I use xchat - so don't know
:) thanks so much makes a big difference to have someone elses help when you're pannicking/stressed.
I know the feeling :-) did you work it out by now?
yes, it was a gigantic file being written to /var/backup (even though I _thought_  I unchecked that /var/backup feature).
good :-))
